page.title: 14Health
page.content: {Basingstoke District Hospital,}in the Hampshire Area Health Authority (Teaching), was built in the extensive grounds of the former Park Prewett Hospital, now known as Basingstoke District Hospital Psychiatric Division. The Maternity Unit was completed first and served as a mini District Hospital while work on the main building was in progress. The General Division with its many wards and departments was officially opened in 1975 by H.R.H. Princess Alexandra. On the same site is the ambulance station for the area, residences for doctors and nurses, sports fields and a golf course. There are no doctors surgeries in the area. There is one full time dentist's surgery and two other dentists practice part time in their own homes.
